rawLines.text:
Oceans cover a significant
portion of the Earth

and, as the spinoff of fish, it's no surprise
that mankind really loves the ocean.

It allows us to cool off in the summer,
produce life-giving oxygen, and, much like whales,
can often be found below sea level.

Because of this, we have learned to treat
the ocean with the care and respect

such a delicate and life-essential
system deserves.

Is what I would have said had this been a
parallel universe in which things made sense.
Unfortunately, we live in the other universe...

Because the ocean is going through
a bit of a rough patch at the moment,

fellow creators MrBeast and Mark Rober
have launched a campaign known as #TeamSeas.

It is a kind of sequel
to the #TeamTrees initiative,

which successfully raised more than $20 000 000
to plant over 20 million trees back in 2019.

But, this time around, the goal is to raise
$30 000 000 to remove 30 million pounds

of trash and plastic from
the ocean, beaches, and rivers.

Which is why almost everyone you follow seems to have
 developed a very sudden passion for oceanography.

In the grand scheme of things,
removing 30 million pounds of trash and plastic
is not going to change the world.

Billions of pounds of trash is dumped into
the ocean every single year.

It will, however, bring awareness to an issue
that affects every single one of us.

And, perhaps, with some luck, that awareness will
inspire those with the power to effect lasting change.
If not today, then perhaps tomorrow.
Who knows.

I think it's a worthy cause, at least,
so I will be donating $1000.

If you'd like to donate yourself,
you should head over to www.teamseas.org.

You'll find a link with additional information
in the description below.
